com.madrobot.net.client.websocket

Class AndroidWebSocketClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.madrobot.net.client.websocket.WebSocket
      • com.madrobot.net.client.websocket.AndroidWebSocketClient

  • public class AndroidWebSocketClient
extends WebSocket
    Android specific WebSocket client that interfaces with the Looper to provide threading control.
    Author:
    stella

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class com.madrobot.net.client.websocket.WebSocket

      AndroidWebSocketClient(String url, String... requestedProtocols)

    • Constructor Detail

      • AndroidWebSocketClient

        public AndroidWebSocketClient(String url,
                      String... requestedProtocols)
        Instantiate the class so that events are directed back at the Looper attached to this thread. In typical parlance, this means that you must instantiate the instance on the main thread. A task will be posted to the current thread to start the instance.
        Parameters:
        url -
        requestedProtocols -

      • AndroidWebSocketClient

        public AndroidWebSocketClient(Handler handler,
                      String url,
                      String... requestedProtocols)
        Instantiate the instance targeting an explicit handler. This variant is typically not used. This constructor does not automatically post a message to the handler to start the instance. The caller must arrange to start it via another means.
        Parameters:
        url -
        requestedProtocols -
